column1: In the manuscript for ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' Sam's suggestion to take the South Lane to the Cotton's farm was accepted. The Travellers went to the farm and the wary Cottons let them in. A fight broke out and six ruffians were killed. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] rewrote this episode so that no ruffians were killed at the farm, instead the hobbits were trapped and planned to burst out. At this point [[Christopher Tolkien]] said his father realized that he had taken a wrong turning; there was no credible way for the hobbits to burst out unscathed.<ref name="Scouring"/>
